availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel A. Sargent (Cincinnati, Ohio, agent and notary public)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, agent and notary public. New Hampshire native. Married to Mary Ann Steel Sargent in Lucas County, Ohio, on September 30, 1837. Father of Mary A Sargent and Julia E. Sargent. Operated a livery stable in Huron County in 1850. Employed Parry Beckwith as an ostler in Huron County in 1850. Employed Alvin Munnahan as an ostler in Huron County in 1850. Agent in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Sarah Brannan as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Mary Hughes as a servant in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed George Voes as a bookkeeper in Cincinnati in 1860. Notary public in Cincinnati in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Huron County, Norwalk, p. 8B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, War 13, p. 256.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, War 22, p. 706B.
Ohio County Marriage Records, 1835-1886, Lucas County Marriage Records, 577.
"Samuel A. Sargent (1813-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #17988584, accessed August 4, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17988584.
